intro: Draba kizyl-arti, commonly known as the Kizyl-arti whitlow grass, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Draba kizyl-arti is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
